column3: This doesn't fix #8160 entirely, but combined with #14037 it does, I think (updated title).
I'm not sure this fixes #8161? Does this add a link to the source repository so that people can find the source code easier?
Added the link to repo. Tell me if I have to rebase the PR.
For the sake of style consistency all executables names should be either quoted within the backticks or not quoted at all.

Fixed typos pointed by @fanquake and @hebasto

PR Description should be:
        fixes #8160 (partially) with #14037, fixes #8161 (see also PR #11971 and #14022)
> For the sake of style consistency all executables names should be either quoted within the backticks or not quoted at all.\n\nI meant `bitcoin-qt.exe` in the Running Windows section as well.
@laanwj I think all points now are checked. Anyway, I made a new PR #14167 with the aim to improve even more the documentation in tar packages. \n

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#14167](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/14167.html) ([WIP] docs: improve linux tar packages by c

In [PR 14755](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14755), I suggest to remove all instructions about running and instead link to the official docs, to avoid duplication. Currently in conflict with this PR. Review/comment requested.  \n(Also related: #14639)\n
Closing this, given that #14167 includes these changes.
It seems that the last '\n' has been deleted.
Yes, not intentional but also not relevant (IMHO)...
@cisba Sure, however as a general rule, we try to keep unrelated/unintentional changes to a minimum (in all PRs), just to ease review. However in this case it's probably fine.
@fanquake I restored the last '\n' and now it seem like I added a blank line... LOL
